intro: Aegilemma peregrina subsp. cylindrostachys, commonly known as the slender-seeded aegilemma, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by cylindrical, woody pods that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
